title: Oil gains a fifth day after U.S. stockpile drop amid rate optimism
text: Oil prices rose for a fifth day on Wednesday, buoyed by a bigger-than-expected drop in U.S. inventories and as investors awaited a widely expected cut in interest rates by the Federal Reserve, the first in more than 10 years.

title: 'Hidden' debtors may be signaling trouble in the global economy
text: Small companies without credit ratings may be the first victims in an economic downturn.

title: U.S. negotiators need to show 'sincerity' in Shanghai talks: China state media
text: Negotiators from the United States should show "sincerity" and temper expectations as they begin a new round of talks with Chinese counterparts to ease trade tensions between the two sides, state-owned tabloid Global Times said on Wednesday.

title: China, U.S. officials meet for trade talks in Shanghai
text: U.S. Trade Representative Robert Lighthizer and Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin shook hands with Chinese Vice Premier Liu He before beginning trade talks in Shanghai on Wednesday in a bid to end a year-long trade war.

title: Asian shares on defensive, pound at 28-month low on hard Brexit fears
text: Asian shares weakened in early trade on Wednesday, rattled by fresh trade war concerns following threats from President Donald Trump to Beijing, while increasing worries about a no-deal Brexit kept the pound under pressure.

title: NYSE President says it's been a busy year in bringing companies public

text: Stocks in Asia were poised to trade lower on Wednesday amid dampened expectations for a resolution to the U.S.-China trade war.

title: Trump warns China against delaying trade deal as talks resume
text: U.S. President Donald Trump on Tuesday warned China against waiting out his first term to finalize any trade deal, saying if he wins re-election in the November 2020 U.S. presidential contest, the outcome will be worse for China.

title: Widely Anticipated Fed Rate Cut May Backfire For Stock Market Bulls
text: Conventional economic wisdom suggests a rate cut will cause stocks to rise, but conventional wisdom hasn’t reflected reality for the last 20 years.

text: The Fed is about to take the unusual step of cutting interest rates to save an economic expansion, not an economy that is in a downward spiral.

title: Tech pulls Wall Street lower on Trump trade warning
text: Wall Street lost ground on Tuesday after a warning from President Donald Trump to China amid ongoing trade negotiations pressured technology shares, while investors looked to an expected Federal Reserve interest rate cut at the conclusion of its monetary policy meeting.

title: The Last Time The Fed Did This, Stocks Soared 36%
text: Immediately following the December move by the Fed, we started looking at the similarities between 1994-1995 and 2018-2019. And that script has played out perfectly.

title: Dow Jones Today: Trump Trade Tweets at It Again

title: Gold is set to surge no matter what the Fed does, traders say

title: How tariff uncertainty drives production out of China and into other Asian countries

title: What Can Investors Expect From the Coming Rate Cut?
text: As investing doctrines go, "Don’t Fight the Fed" is a pretty good one. While value investors may grumble about the distorting effect of low interest rates on market fundamentals, the reality is central banks affect asset prices in very immediate and significant ways.

title: U.S. could have decision on companies selling to Huawei by next week
text: The Trump administration could by next week issue decisions to companies that have requested special licenses to sell to Chinese telecoms giant Huawei, U.S. Commerce Secretary Wilbur Ross said on Tuesday during a visit to Brazil.

title: Moderate U.S. consumer spending, inflation back Fed rate cut
text: U.S. consumer spending and prices rose moderately in June, pointing to slower economic growth and benign inflation that could see the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates on Wednesday for the first time in a decade.

title: Oil rises on expectations of Fed rate cut, another U.S. crude drawdown
text: Oil prices rose on Tuesday, on track to close at a two-week high, on optimism the U.S. Federal Reserve will cut interest rates this week for the first time in more than 10 years, boosting demand expectations in the world's biggest oil user.

title: Small energy stock rips higher after investor Mario Gabelli says he is following it
text: Shares of RPC, Inc., a small oil and gas company based in Atlanta, jump following positive comments from billionaire investor Mario Gabelli.
